Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Boston \Bos"ton\, n. A game at cards, played by four persons, with two packs of fifty-two cards each; -- said to be so called from Boston, Massachusetts, and to have been invented by officers of the French army in America during the Revolutionary war. [1913 Webster] ||
Boston n : state capital and largest city of Massachusetts; a major center for banking and financial services [syn: {Hub of the Universe}, {Bean Town}, {Beantown}, {capital of Massachusetts}]
